title: YAMY Configuration
description: JSON configuration schema for YAMY keyboard remapper

version.description: Configuration format version. Must be '2.0' for this schema.

keys.description: Mapping of key names to scan codes. Each key name must map to a hexadecimal scan code (e.g., '0x1e' for the A key).

^[A-Za-z0-9_]+$.description: Hexadecimal scan code for this key (e.g., '0x1e', '0xcb')

virtualModifiers.description: Virtual modifier definitions (M00-MFF). Virtual modifiers enable modal editing by treating a key as a modifier when held, with optional tap action.

^M[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}$.description: Virtual modifier configuration. Name must be M00-MFF (e.g., M00, M01, MFF).

trigger.description: Key name that activates this virtual modifier (e.g., 'CapsLock', 'Semicolon'). Must match a key defined in keyboard.keys.

tapAction.description: Optional key to send when trigger is tapped (pressed and released quickly) instead of held. Useful for dual-purpose keys (e.g., CapsLock as modifier when held, Escape when tapped).

holdThresholdMs.description: Time in milliseconds to distinguish between tap and hold. Default is 200ms.

mappings.description: Key mapping rules that remap input keys to output actions

from.description: Input key specification with optional modifiers. Format: [Modifier-]...[Modifier-]KeyName. Standard modifiers: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. Virtual modifiers: M00-MFF. Examples: 'A', 'Shift-A', 'M00-H', 'Shift-M00-A'.

to.description: Output action. Can be a single key string (e.g., 'Tab') or an array of keys for sequences (e.g., ['Esc', 'B']). Keys can include modifiers (e.g., 'Ctrl-C', 'Shift-Delete').

oneOf.description: Single output key with optional modifiers (e.g., 'Tab', 'Ctrl-C', 'Shift-Delete')
Sequence of keys to send in order (e.g., ['Escape', 'B'] for vim-style sequence)

description.description: Optional human-readable description of what this mapping does

mappings.description: Send Escape then B when CapsLock+B is pressed
